results.title: Living with earth: the Loma Prieta Earthquake
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Examines human responses to the destructive forces of natural phenomena such as earthquakes. In particular, the San Francisco quake of 1989 is highlighted. Geologists, scientists, engineers and civic planners studied the earthquake and its effects to determine how to better manage a crisis situation given that San Francisco rests on the San Andreas fault line. Although earthquake predicting technology is in its early protype stages, the aim of developing this area will be beneficial in lessening the impact of one natural disaster.

results.title: Metamorphic rocks
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The process of metamorphism changes the structure and composition of rocks; an atomic shuffling which results in change. Metamorphism for example is responsible for changing limestone into marble. There are two types of metamorphism; contact metamorphism resulting from a cooling process and regional metamorphism which is the result of tectonic activity. As a consequence of this process, many rare minerals can be formed.

results.title: Sedimentry rocks
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Illustrates the importance of sedimentary rocks in understanding earth’s history. Sediment is the result of chemical and mechanical weathering assisted by erosion, water, ice and biological activities such as movement of dunes. Sedimentary rocks hold much of the fossil evidence which provide insight into the evolution of life on earth. The building up of sedimentary layers results in the formation of structures such as reefs and formations like limestone caves.

results.title: Plate dynamics
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Although a relatively new accepted field in Geology, the theory of Plate Tectonics, has enabled geologists to understand the ways in which the Earth’s plates move and interact. Three types of plate movements have been analysed and involve convergence of two plates, the divergence of plates and in the case of geological phenomena like the San Andreas Fault, Transformation Faults whereby the continental plates are continually slipping past each other.

results.title: The Birth of a theory
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Addresses some controversial geological theories including the theories of Continental Drift and Plate Tectonics. It was only in the middle of the 20th Century that scientists accepted that the major continents were once joined and then drifted apart due to the geological activity occuring on and beneath the Earth’s surface. The study of the ocean floor provided valuable evidence which enabled the theory to eventually gain popular support.

results.title: The Sea floor
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The sea-floor is the focus of submarine geologists. Water covers 70% of the planet’s surface and contains many of tye minerals and elements which sustain life itself. The sea-floor is largely basaltic, while continental landmasses are largely granitic. Like the landmass on the planet surface, the sea-floor has a volcanic structure, which gives rise to its varying seascapes mid-oceanic ridges, ocean trenches and fracture zones. The use of deep sea robots have enabled submarine geologists to understand how old the sea floor is.

results.title: Earth's interior
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Seismic waves, earthquakes and close study of rocks can give insight into the structure of the Earth. This episode looks at the field of geophysics in order to determine what the three composite parts which make up the Earth’s structure, i.e. the crust, mantle and core, are like. Measuring the magnetism in the Earth and its magnetic fields, looking at heat flow and measuring the Earth’s gravity are discussed. Geophysical research links the study of gravity, magnetism and seismology in order to fully comprehend the complexity of our planet.

results.title: Organic evolution
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: biology”.
Organic evolution traces the development of various theories of evolution. It begins with the Biblical account of creation and discusses the work of Mendel, Darwin and the Hardy-Weinberg law. Examines microscopic and macroscopic organisms, genetics, heredity, cell reproduction, breeding populations, hypothesis and observation. The six episodes are entitled: 1. “In the Beginning” 2. “Darwin, naturally” 3. “Factoring in Mendel” 4. “The Meiotic mix” 5. “The Population picture” 6. “Mutation and all that.”

results.title: Wave-partical duality
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Traces the development of the various theories advanced to explain the behaviour of light, from the concepts of the ancient Greeks to current proven models. The contributions of Isaac Newtown, Christian Huygens, Thomas Young, Jean Foucault, Albert Einstein and others are outlined as are the reasons for the gradual acceptance of both particle and wave models and their eventual combination. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Particle model” 2. “The Wave model” 3. “The Electromagnetic model” 4. “The Quantum idea” 5. “Photons” 6. “Matter waves.”

results.title: World of Apu = World of Apu
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray and Satyajit Ray Production
results.brief_description: The third in the Apu trilogy, the scene opens in Calcutta, where Apu, now a jobless ex-student, dreams of becoming a writer. Extracted from this insular environment, Apu’s life changes when he visits a village and exchanges himself for the mad bridegroom. After his wife’s death during childbirth, Apu leaves Calcutta. His life becomes one filled with indifference. Apu’s journey back to the world is painful but ultimately fulfilling. This is a moving film, considered to be one of Ray’s best, perhaps because the theme is so profound: that without death there cannot be life. The music by Ravi Shankar adds to the film’s power. Based on the text by Bibhutibhusan Banerji.
